p: Each emulsion was prepared by dispersing 83 mg of oil (SBO, PGO, PHY, and IO) into 10 mL of freshly prepared digestion fluid [a mixture of duodenal juice and bile juice (2:1, v/ v)] via an ultrasonic processor (VC750, Sonics & Materials Inc., Newtown, CT, USA) in a 25-mL glass vial for 1 min (6200–6300 Joules), respectively. The oil droplet size was measured by a laser diffraction analyser (Mastersizer S, Malvern Instrument Ltd., Worcestershire, UK). The particle size was reported as the surface-weighted mean diameter, d 32 = ∑n id i 3/∑n id i 2, where n i is the number of particles with diameter (d i). Samples were analyzed in duplicate.
